data.title: Berkeley Repertory Theatre
data.meta_description: With an original rock score and lyrics by Michael Weiner and Zoe Sarnak, Galileo is an explosive collision of science and faith, truth and power.
data.text:
BOOK BY DANNY STRONG

SONGS BY MICHAEL WEINER & ZOE SARNAK

CHOREOGRAPHED BY DAVID NEUMANN

DIRECTED BY MICHAEL MAYER

WORLD PREMIERE

RODA THEATRE

MAY 5–JUN 23, 2024

Spellbinding…a ceaselessly high-octane rock music score exploited mightily by the wicked talents of director Michael Mayer.

KQED

Raúl Esparza is brilliant…he sets the stage ablaze.

San Jose Mercury News

Raucous, sumptuous, and moving.

SFist

Exceptionally acted…a gorgeous production.

Berkeleyside

Visually stunning, intellectually stimulating.

BroadwayWorld

If you skip this production of Galileo, you will miss something compelling, powerful, even magical.

Talkin’ Broadway

Four-time Tony Award nominee Raúl Esparza stars in a dazzling world-premiere musical helmed by Tony Award winner Michael Mayer (Spring Awakening, American Idiot, Swept Away), written by two-time Emmy winner Danny Strong (Dopesick, Empire, The Butler). When maverick scientist Galileo Galilei makes celestial observations that challenge humanity’s understanding of its place in the universe, he’s summoned to Rome to defend his discoveries before the most powerful religious institution in the world, which is facing a rebellion of its own. With an original rock score and lyrics by Michael Weiner (Broadway’s First Date) and Zoe Sarnak (The Lonely Few, Empire Records), Galileo is an explosive collision of science and faith, truth and power. Galileo will likely join the constellation of world premieres that traveled from Berkeley Rep to Broadway — be the first to see it here!

Production information

Runtime: Approximately two hours and 30 minutes including one 15-minute intermission

Stage effects advisory: None

Content advisory: Loud noises and sound effects throughout
